the mauritania railway nicknamed the
backbone of the sahara is 430 miles long
and carries 22 000 tons of iron ore
across the blazing
sahara every day many locals illegally
jump onto the cargo cars starting from
the coast
to transport food and supplies to remote
villages into the desert
and some brave souls use it to go from
the remote mining town of zuwarat
all the way to the coastal town of
nuedibu which is exactly the experience
we're about to embark on the journey can
be treacherous
as the temperatures go into extreme heat
during the day all the way to extreme
cold at night often dropping down to
below freezing temperatures
the main danger however is to fall off
the train as it jerks and leaves you
stranded alone
in the desert this adventure and
experience however promises for a
completely unique look

after 20 hours of delirious sleep going
from dreaming to getting jerked awake by

we completed the entire iron ore train
the combination of extreme physical
challenge and the beauty of the
wilderness of the sahara desert
made for a truly breathtaking adventure
on the other hand
it was also very hard to imagine the
locals having to experience this on a
regular basis
to move supplies leaving we felt immense
first-hand empathy for those who have no
other choice but to travel
